reporter_caption.center: STATE EX REL ANDERSON v. STATE, 2000-2033 (La. 8/1/00); 766 So.2d 1263

caption.center: STATE EX REL ALLEN ANDERSON v. STATE OF LOUISIANA.

opinion.posture: IN RE: Anderson, Allen; â€” Plaintiff; Applying for Supervisory and/or Remedial Writs, Parish of Orleans, Criminal District Court Div. C, Nos., 233-762;
opinion.opinion_text:
Relator represents that the district court has failed to act timely on a motion to vacate sentence and set aside guilty plea he filed on or about April 27, 2000. If relator's representation is correct, the district court is ordered to consider and act on the motion. If relator's representation is incorrect, the district court is ordered to accept, file, and act upon the pleading which is herewith transferred to the district court. The district court is ordered to provide this Court with a copy of its judgment.
